snippet.title: Police release footage of attempted ram raid in appeal for help
snippet.content: Police have released CCTV footage of an attempted ATM theft north of Brisbane, in a public appeal for help to find those responsible for the failed ram raid. A stolen ute was driven through the front doors of a shopping centre on Anzac Avenue, Kallangur, just before 4am on July 28, according to police.Photo: Queensland Police Service Footage shows the ute driving into the shopping centre and reversing into a standalone ATM in an attempt to remove it. The ute was rammed into the ATM a number of times but failed to dislodge it, and the vehicle was reverse back out through the entry. No money was stolen.Photo: Queensland Police Media Police said a grey dual cab ute believed to be involved in the incident was found burnt-out shortly afterwards at Tamborine Circuit. The Isuzu ute had been stolen from a Bellmere property at some point in the night on July 19. Police are appealing for anyone who noticed any suspicious activity at the time or anyone with information about the incident to contact police.
